mentor.title: the mentor checklist
mentor.headline: Are you ready to become a mentor?
mentor.point1: I work in the digital industry
mentor.point2: I am willing to share knowledge and experiences with others
mentor.point3: I am open to meet other nationalities
mentor.point4: I have the time to meet mentees during my free time
mentor.point5: I have time to support on a personal and professional level

mentee.title: the mentee checklist
mentee.headline: Are you ready to become a mentee?
mentee.point1: I am a student or student alumni at ReDI school
mentee.point2: I would like help on my classes and/or career development
mentee.point3: I would like to get guidance from an expert from the digital industry
mentee.point4: I can make time to meet with a mentor on a regular basis
mentee.point5: I am open to get feedback on the topics I disscuss with my mentor

quoteKhaled.title: Anna, mentee and almumna of RedI School
quoteKhaled.text: A friend in React, my course, made me sign up for the mentoring program, this is how I met Khaled. He was my mentor for a year. (so grateful to her and to Khaled!) ... last year I started an internship and I now work as a frontend developer.

quoteHalil.title: Halil Esmer, student of the Digital Career Program, Berlin
quoteHalil.text: I joined the mentorship program in 2019. My mentor gave me important incentives how I can start a career in IT. He showed me how a recruiter would look at my application and how to create specific applications for each position I apply for.

quoteDragos.title: Dragos Nedelcu, Mentor at RedI School & Software Developer
quoteDragos.text: I first came in touch with mentoring as a mentee. It was not until I joined the Mentorship Program at RedI School in Berlin that I became a mentor myself. I believe mentoring is crucial and critical to individual and organizational success.
